text: Emilio Botín-Sanz de Sautuola y García de los Ríos (1 October 1934 - 10 September 2014) was a Spanish banker and businessman. He was the Executive Chairman of Grupo Santander until his death. The bank is the largest in the Eurozone. He was a billionaire. Botín was born in Santander, Cantabria. He was married to Spanish nobility Paloma O'Shea, giving Botín an extended title. They had six children: Ana, Carmen, Carolina, Paloma, Javier and Emilio. He was a Roman Catholic. Botín died from a heart attack on 10 September 2014 in Madrid. He was 79. His eldest daughter Ana now has his job as Chair of Santander. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Emilio Botín at the Grupo Santander website Category:1934 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Spanish billionaires Category:Spanish businesspeople Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Nobility Category:People from Cantabria Category:Spanish Roman Catholics
title: Emilio Botín
